security_audit.summary: The skill contains only a brief description and references to shared workflow documents. No code execution, file access, or network behavior is present.

content.user_title: Write TypeScript code with Metabase standards
content.value_statement: You need TypeScript or JavaScript code that matches Metabase conventions. This skill generates or refactors code using stated standards and best practices.
actual_capabilities: Generate TypeScript code for new features
Generate JavaScript code for existing modules
Refactor TS or JS to align with Metabase conventions
Apply general TS and JS best practices in output
limitations: Does not execute or test code
Does not inspect your repository automatically
Cannot guarantee style compliance without project context

use_cases.title: Refactor a module
use_cases.description: Clean up a TS or JS module to better match Metabase standards.

use_cases.title: Draft new utility
use_cases.description: Create a small TS or JS utility with clear structure and best practices.

use_cases.title: Review guidance
use_cases.description: Get a quick draft that follows Metabase coding conventions for review.

prompt_templates.title: Create TS function
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a TypeScript helper that formats a date string. Follow Metabase standards and explain any assumptions.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor JS file
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor this JavaScript snippet for clarity and best practices. Keep behavior the same and align with Metabase style.

prompt_templates.title: Add types
prompt_templates.prompt: Add strong TypeScript types to this function and update the call sites. Keep the logic unchanged.

prompt_templates.title: Design suggestion
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a Metabase style approach for structuring a TS module with helpers, types, and exports.

output_examples.input: Refactor this JS utility for readability and Metabase style.
output: Explained the main changes and why they improve clarity
Listed refactor steps that keep behavior unchanged
Noted any assumptions about existing data shapes

best_practices: Provide relevant code context and constraints
State expected behavior and edge cases
Ask for Metabase style preferences if unclear
anti_patterns: Asking for code execution or deployment
Providing no context for the existing code

faq.question: Is this compatible with my editor or IDE?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides guidance and code you can paste into any editor.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It does not run code or validate against your repository automatically.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my build tools?
faq.answer: It does not integrate directly, but you can apply the output in your tools.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: This skill definition contains no data access or network behavior.

faq.question: What if the output does not match my style?
faq.answer: Provide your project conventions and request a revision with those rules.

faq.question: How does it compare to a general coding assistant?
faq.answer: It focuses on TypeScript and JavaScript with Metabase standards in mind.
